organization.$: Department of Materials Science and Technology
Department of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering

head.citation-title: Bacterial cellulose: Biosyntheses, modifications, and applications
head.abstracts: © 2017 by IGI Global. All rights reserved.Bacterial cellulose, synthesized by bacteria, is one of the most highly pure cellulose sources. It hasgained a great attention due to its unique properties. With molecular similarity to cellulose derived fromplants, bacterial cellulose can be modified based on diverse techniques established for the plant-derivedcellulose. Modification of cellulose has become one of the major areas of cellulose research to providecellulose-based materials with novel properties. The progress in cellulose science has also opened upmore potentials for bacterial cellulose. This chapter describes an overview of biosyntheses, modifications,and applications of bacterial cellulose.

organization.$: Department of Materials Science and Technology

affiliation.affilname: College of Engineering and Polymer Science

coredata.dc:description: Bacterial cellulose, synthesized by bacteria, is one of the most highly pure cellulose sources. It hasgained a great attention due to its unique properties. With molecular similarity to cellulose derived fromplants, bacterial cellulose can be modified based on diverse techniques established for the plant-derivedcellulose. Modification of cellulose has become one of the major areas of cellulose research to providecellulose-based materials with novel properties. The progress in cellulose science has also opened upmore potentials for bacterial cellulose. This chapter describes an overview of biosyntheses, modifications,and applications of bacterial cellulose.
coredata.prism:publicationName: Applied Environmental Materials Science for Sustainability
coredata.dc:title: Bacterial cellulose: Biosyntheses, modifications, and applications
